title: [Large-scale] Design and Implementation of Instructor Training Programs for Emergency Transition to Remote Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms and understanding of fundamental instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Training program for instructors needing rapid transition to remote education during emergencies like COVID-19. Emphasis on teachable design and execution strategies feasible in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Demonstrate the ability to utilize minimum essential technical tools (video conferencing, LMS) for emergency remote education transitions through a three-stage practical assessment.
Design and receive peer feedback on at least two pedagogical methods (discussion boards, quizzes) suitable for asynchronous learning activities.
Propose and implement at least three mobile-friendly content development strategies to enhance learner engagement.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
